trans-unit.source: How to: Create a WCF SOAP Client Application

trans-unit.source: How to: Create a WCF SOAP Client Application for the Service Bus
trans-unit.target: How to: Create a WCF SOAP Client Application for the Service Bus

trans-unit.source: The following topic describes how to create a traditional client application that accesses <token>sb1</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following topic describes how to create a traditional client application that accesses <token>sb1</token>.

trans-unit.source: <token>crabout</token> building a client application, see <link xlink:href="28dfff47-d95b-4cc2-9d5c-b3b9ba71fd50" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Building Clients</link> in the <token>indigo1</token> documentation.
trans-unit.target: <token>crabout</token> building a client application, see <link xlink:href="28dfff47-d95b-4cc2-9d5c-b3b9ba71fd50" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Building Clients</link> in the <token>indigo1</token> documentation.

trans-unit.source: The following procedure is a simplified process for creating a client application that highlights the features unique to <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following procedure is a simplified process for creating a client application that highlights the features unique to <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: For a complete sample, see the <externalLink><linkText>Relayed Messaging</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Relayed-Messaging-Windows-0d2cede3</linkUri></externalLink> <token>sb2</token> sample, or <link xlink:href="5f12fee8-10c1-4357-8a88-5b927c58e397" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 5: Create an AppFabric Service Bus Client</link> in the <link xlink:href="24332c3c-277f-46f2-949a-d4381b8bfb0b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">AppFabric Service Bus Tutorial</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a complete sample, see the <externalLink><linkText>Relayed Messaging</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Relayed-Messaging-Windows-0d2cede3</linkUri></externalLink> <token>sb2</token> sample, or <link xlink:href="5f12fee8-10c1-4357-8a88-5b927c58e397" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 5: Create an AppFabric Service Bus Client</link> in the <link xlink:href="24332c3c-277f-46f2-949a-d4381b8bfb0b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">AppFabric Service Bus Tutorial</link>.

trans-unit.source: To create a Service Bus client application
trans-unit.target: To create a Service Bus client application

trans-unit.source: Retrieve a copy of the contract for the service and include it in your code:
trans-unit.target: Retrieve a copy of the contract for the service and include it in your code:

trans-unit.source: You can retrieve the contract from the service in a variety of ways, such as through metadata exposed by the service.
trans-unit.target: You can retrieve the contract from the service in a variety of ways, such as through metadata exposed by the service.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="0451f22f-aab0-4e5c-b76c-25c4264be242" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Design an AppFabric Service Bus Contract</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="0451f22f-aab0-4e5c-b76c-25c4264be242" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Design an AppFabric Service Bus Contract</link>.

trans-unit.source: Add references to the <codeEntityReference>N:System.ServiceModel</codeEntityReference> and <codeEntityReference>N:Microsoft.ServiceBus</codeEntityReference> namespaces to your project:
trans-unit.target: Add references to the <codeEntityReference>N:System.ServiceModel</codeEntityReference> and <codeEntityReference>N:Microsoft.ServiceBus</codeEntityReference> namespaces to your project:

trans-unit.source: Retrieve your <token>servicensd</token> and relevant credential information:
trans-unit.target: Retrieve your <token>servicensd</token> and relevant credential information:

trans-unit.source: The previous code assumes that the service endpoint requires SAS key credentials.
trans-unit.target: The previous code assumes that the service endpoint requires SAS key credentials.

trans-unit.source: Service endpoints may not require authentication; if one did not require authentication, setting the SAS policy name and key would also not be necessary.
trans-unit.target: Service endpoints may not require authentication; if one did not require authentication, setting the SAS policy name and key would also not be necessary.

trans-unit.source: The type of security and authentication that is required to connect is defined by the service.
trans-unit.target: The type of security and authentication that is required to connect is defined by the service.

trans-unit.source: You can retrieve this information in a variety of ways, such as through metadata that the service exposes.
trans-unit.target: You can retrieve this information in a variety of ways, such as through metadata that the service exposes.

trans-unit.source: <token>Crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="0451f22f-aab0-4e5c-b76c-25c4264be242" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Design an AppFabric Service Bus Contract</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>Crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="0451f22f-aab0-4e5c-b76c-25c4264be242" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Design an AppFabric Service Bus Contract</link>.

trans-unit.source: This topic assumes that the <token>sb2</token> endpoint requires client applications to authenticate and uses SAS credentials.
trans-unit.target: This topic assumes that the <token>sb2</token> endpoint requires client applications to authenticate and uses SAS credentials.

trans-unit.source: (An endpoint may not require any authentication, although this example does.)
trans-unit.target: (An endpoint may not require any authentication, although this example does.)

trans-unit.source: You can also use other credential types, such as a simple Web token (SWT), or SAML.
trans-unit.target: You can also use other credential types, such as a simple Web token (SWT), or SAML.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you can also set the client transport or message-level security.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you can also set the client transport or message-level security.

trans-unit.source: However, for many scenarios, the default settings are sufficient.
trans-unit.target: However, for many scenarios, the default settings are sufficient.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating an AppFabric Service Bus Connection</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating an AppFabric Service Bus Connection</link>.

trans-unit.source: Define the security credentials to use with the endpoint:
trans-unit.target: Define the security credentials to use with the endpoint:

trans-unit.source: The previous example assumes that the service endpoint requires SAS credentials.
trans-unit.target: The previous example assumes that the service endpoint requires SAS credentials.

trans-unit.source: Service endpoints may not require authentication; if authentication is not required, skip this step and step 8, later in this section.
trans-unit.target: Service endpoints may not require authentication; if authentication is not required, skip this step and step 8, later in this section.

trans-unit.source: Create a URI object pointing to the <token>sb2</token> service, as shown in the following code:
trans-unit.target: Create a URI object pointing to the <token>sb2</token> service, as shown in the following code:

trans-unit.source: In this code example, the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.CreateServiceUri(System.String,System.String,System.String)</codeEntityReference> method takes the schema (<codeInline>“sb”</codeInline> for <token>sb2</token>, used for TCP relay connections), the <token>servicensd</token>, and the name of the endpoint to which to connect.
trans-unit.target: In this code example, the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.CreateServiceUri(System.String,System.String,System.String)</codeEntityReference> method takes the schema (<codeInline>“sb”</codeInline> for <token>sb2</token>, used for TCP relay connections), the <token>servicensd</token>, and the name of the endpoint to which to connect.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="5c3dbfcc-60b7-45fa-87b7-8d652065f208" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating an AppFabric Service Bus URI</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="5c3dbfcc-60b7-45fa-87b7-8d652065f208" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating an AppFabric Service Bus URI</link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the client endpoint used to connect to the service.
trans-unit.target: Configure the client endpoint used to connect to the service.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the client endpoint is defined using the name <codeInline>“RelayEndpoint”</codeInline>, which is used later to help create the channel factory.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the client endpoint is defined using the name <codeInline>“RelayEndpoint”</codeInline>, which is used later to help create the channel factory.

trans-unit.source: The endpoint configuration also declares the contract defined in the first step of this procedure, as well as the fact that the binding used to connect is a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: The endpoint configuration also declares the contract defined in the first step of this procedure, as well as the fact that the binding used to connect is a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: For this procedure, the information is declared in an App.config file.
trans-unit.target: For this procedure, the information is declared in an App.config file.

trans-unit.source: You can also define this information programmatically.
trans-unit.target: You can also define this information programmatically.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="c3c38827-e436-4e31-8ea6-3d90e6d169d4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="c3c38827-e436-4e31-8ea6-3d90e6d169d4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>.

trans-unit.source: Instantiate a channel factory:
trans-unit.target: Instantiate a channel factory:

trans-unit.source: This channel factory uses the type of channel defined in the client contract at the beginning of this procedure.
trans-unit.target: This channel factory uses the type of channel defined in the client contract at the beginning of this procedure.

trans-unit.source: Apply the credentials and any other behaviors to the endpoint:
trans-unit.target: Apply the credentials and any other behaviors to the endpoint:

trans-unit.source: The preceding code example assumes that the service endpoint requires SAS credentials.
trans-unit.target: The preceding code example assumes that the service endpoint requires SAS credentials.

trans-unit.source: Service endpoints may or may not require authentication; if an endpoint does not require authentication, adding the credential behavior to the client endpoint would not be required.
trans-unit.target: Service endpoints may or may not require authentication; if an endpoint does not require authentication, adding the credential behavior to the client endpoint would not be required.

trans-unit.source: Create a new channel to the service and open it:
trans-unit.target: Create a new channel to the service and open it:

trans-unit.source: Perform whatever tasks are necessary for your scenario:
trans-unit.target: Perform whatever tasks are necessary for your scenario:

trans-unit.source: This step consists of accessing the service application through the exposed endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This step consists of accessing the service application through the exposed endpoint.

trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="5f8947bc-26c6-4b15-a3a4-74bd3a0edb58" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Hosting an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished, close the channel, as shown in the following code:
